intro: Carlephyton darainense, commonly known as the Darainese fern, is a unique vascular plant characterized by its intricate frond structure. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to the humid rainforests of Southeast Asia. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit with bipinnate leaves that exhibit a delicate, feathery appearance. Its reproductive structures include sori that are clustered on the undersides of the fronds. Carlephyton darainense plays a vital role in its ecosystem by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
